#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Use Wooden Chopsticks
#Text=Eating with chopsticks can be intimidating , especially if you have n't learned how to use them from a young age .
#Text=However , there is no need to be intimidated .
#Text=With a little practice , you can easily figure out how to maneuver chopsticks with ease .
#Text=Make sure you hold chopsticks correctly and then use them to gently pick up food to eat .
#Text=You should also be aware of basic rules of etiquette regarding chopsticks , especially when eating out at a restaurant .
#Text=With some practice , you can master the art of using chopsticks .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Setting Up Your Chopsticks
#Text=Break apart your chopsticks .
#Text=Pick up your chopsticks , holding one chopstick in each hand .
#Text=Press forward on one stick while pulling the stick closer to you backwards .
#Text=Your chopsticks should break apart down the middle .
#Text=Also , make sure to lower the sticks to your knees before breaking them to avoid hitting any dishes on the table .
#Text=Rub the chopsticks together to remove splinters .
#Text=There are sometimes splinters near where the chopsticks broke .
#Text=If you notice any splinters on your chopsticks , gently rub the chopsticks together a few times to remove them .
#Text=However , when using nicer wooden chopsticks , especially non-disposable ones , avoid rubbing them together .
#Text=Do not break off the wood block at the end of your chopsticks .
#Text=Contrary to popular belief , you are not supposed to break off the wood block at the end of your chopsticks .
#Text=The wood does not break off easily and can cause your chopsticks to splinter and even break .
#Text=Do not touch the wood block at the end of your chopsticks after breaking them apart .
#Text=Holding the Chopsticks
#Text=Hold the first chopstick with your thumb , pointer , and middle finger .
#Text=Wooden chopsticks are held and used in the same fashion as any other type of chopstick .
#Text=Hold the first chopstick with the tips of your index and middle finger .
#Text=Use the tip of your thumb to keep the chopstick balanced in a straight line across your hand .
#Text=Do n't worry if you do n't get it right immediately .
#Text=It takes some practice to correctly balance chopsticks .
#Text=Place the second chopstick between your thumb and palm .
#Text=Your second chopstick should be placed below the first one .
#Text=Place it between your thumb and palm , moving your thumb inward towards the palm to firmly hold the chopstick in place .
#Text=This chopstick does not move when you eat .
#Text=Again , do not sweat it if it 's hard at first .
#Text=It does take a little practice .
#Text=Move the top chopstick with your middle and index finger .
#Text=Once you 're holding your chopsticks correctly , make sure you can maneuver them correctly .
#Text=Only the top chopstick should move and you should only use your index and middle finger to move it .
#Text=Your thumb should remain still .
#Text=It can take some practice to use chopsticks correctly .
#Text=Give yourself time to practice the basic motions before handling food .
#Text=Strive to be aware of your thumb and to keep it still .
#Text=This will allow you to have better control of the chopsticks .
#Text=If you 're used to using a different type of chopstick , like ceramic chopsticks , it may take awhile to adjust to the new texture .
#Text=Handling Food
#Text=Grab food with the upper and lower chopstick .
#Text=Using chopsticks is simple once you have the basic motions down .
#Text=You simply move the upper chopstick with your index and middle finger to separate the chopsticks .
#Text=Then , grab food between the upper and lower chopstick and bring it to your plate or mouth .
#Text=While this seems simple , do not get frustrated if it takes time to master .
#Text=Using chopsticks can be tricky at first , especially if you 've always used forks and spoons in the past .
#Text=Give yourself time to get used to the movement .
#Text=Shovel rice with chopsticks .
#Text=In most Asian countries , rice can be pushed into your mouth with chopsticks .
#Text=When eating rice , hold the bowl face level .
#Text=Hold your chopsticks side by side and gently push the rice into your mouth .
#Text=However , this is not considered appropriate in Korean culture , so do not do this when eating in a Korean restaurant .
#Text=Avoid letting the chopsticks cross while grasping food .
#Text=When picking up food with your chopsticks , make sure the ends do not cross over one another and make an " X " .
#Text=This will make it very difficult to pick up food .
#Text=If your chopsticks cross at the ends , you 're gripping your food too tightly .
#Text=Let go of the food and try to grab it again more gently .
#Text=Practicing Proper Etiquette
#Text=Do not impale food with a chopstick .
#Text=While it seems like an easy solution if you 're having trouble grasping food , never use a chopstick to impale food and bring it to your mouth .
#Text=As this is not what chopsticks are designed for , food can easily slip off if you use chopsticks like this .
#Text=It is also generally considered bad manners .
#Text=Do not place your chopsticks upright in rice .
#Text=In some Buddhist cultures , rice is offered to someone 's spirit at a shrine after death .
#Text=When rice is offered to a spirit , chopsticks are left sitting upright in rice .
#Text=In general , avoid placing chopsticks upright in rice , as this could potentially be seen as insulting to Buddhist cultures .
#Text=Not everyone who uses chopsticks practices Buddhism , but it 's always best to err on the side of caution , especially if you 're eating in a restaurant where the culture is unfamiliar to you .
#Text=Do not leave your chopsticks crossed on your plate or bowl .
#Text=Chopsticks crossed on a bowl or plate are sometimes used in funeral rituals in Asian cultures .
#Text=While not all Asian cultures practice such rituals , it 's a good idea to avoid crossing your chopsticks just in case .
#Text=If you 're not eating , set your chopsticks side by side near your plate instead of leaving them crossed on the plate .
#Text=Do not wash chopsticks in drinks or soup .
#Text=It is generally considered unsanitary to wash your chopsticks in your drinks or your soup after using them .
#Text=If your chopsticks are dirty , wipe them off with a napkin or get a clean pair instead of contaminating soup or water with food particles .
#Text=Avoid passing food from chopstick to chopstick .
#Text=Some Buddhist funeral rites involve passing the bones of the deceased from chopstick to chopstick after cremation .
#Text=Therefore , it 's generally considered a faux pas to pass food between chopsticks as this can be a reminder of death and funerals .
